title: Jaguar’s turning its used batteries into portable EV chargers
content:
On its way to net zero, Jaguar has developed a portable EV charger, powered by “second-life” batteries from prototype and test I-Pace vehicles.  The so-called Off Grid Battery Energy Storage System (ESS) is essentially an energy storage unit, designed to supply power where access to electricity is limited or unavailable.  The portable EV charger was created in collaboration with Pramac. Image: Jaguar The device has a capacity of up to 125kWh — more than enough to juice up the I-Pace or to power a house for a week, says Jaguar — and can be topped up via integrated solar panels. …

description: Jaguar is exploring new ways to upcycle batteries after they've been removed from electric cars.
